column4: U.S. attempt to unlock San Bernardino iPhone could impact N.Y. case: Apple
column5: NEW YORK Apple Inc said the U.S. Justice Department's new attempts to unlock an iPhone used by one of the San Bernardino shooters without the tech giant's help could eliminate the government's need for its assistance in a similar dispute in New York.

column4: Gilead ordered to pay Merck $200 mln in hepatitis C drug patent dispute
column5: SAN JOSE  Calif. /NEW YORK A federal jury on Thursday ordered Gilead Sciences Inc to pay Merck & Co  $200 million in damages for infringing two Merck patents related to a lucrative cure for hepatitis C.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. approves $3.2 bln sale of Boeing P-8A patrol planes to UK
column5: WASHINGTON  March 25 The U.S. government has approved the sale of up to nine Boeing Co P-8A Poseidon maritime patrol planes to Britain in a deal valued at up to $3.2 billion  the U.S. Defense Department said Friday.

column4: CNH takes $500 mln charge over EU cartel probe
column5: MILAN  March 25 Truck and tractor maker CNH Industrial said it was booking a $500 million charge in relation to a European Commission cartel investigation that could lead to heavy fines for some of the world's biggest truckmakers.

column4: Fitch Affirms Coca-Cola's IDRs at 'A+/F1'; Outlook Negative
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  March 25 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed the Issuer Default Ratings  (IDRs) and the debt ratings of The Coca-Cola Company (Coca-Cola) and its  subsidiaries at 'A+/F1'. The Rating Outlook is Negative. A full list of rating  actions follows at the end of this release.  KEY RATING DRIVERS The Negative Outlook reflects Coca-Cola's elevated leverage (on both a gross  leverage and supplemental net leverage basis) as currently high

column4: Delta Air Lines in agreement to settle lawsuit against Republic
column5: Delta Air Lines Inc has agreed to settle a lawsuit that accused Republic Airways Holdings Inc of breaching a contract to operate flights for Delta  Republic said in a news release Thursday.

column4: Yokohama Rubber to buy Alliance Tire Group for about $1.2 billion

column4: Lockheed gets $1.5 billion deal for C-130J aircraft: Pentagon
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp  has won a contract worth $1.5 billion for work on 28 C-130J military transport aircraft funded by the fiscal 2016 defense budget  the Pentagon said on Thursday in its daily digest of major contracts.

column4: Premier Foods investors urge McCormick talks after Nissin deal
